Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky black; traces of concentric added white red bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. The number 81 is written in pencil and crossed out on the exterior surface of the sherd. The number 5 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd and on a paper label glued to the interior.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 678, no. 375)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0943) (phase 2)
